Legendary Purebreds: Anything Works!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive (GameBoy Advance): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Legendary Purebreds: Anything Works!
By Kurasu Soratobu on Wednesday, October 27, 2010 - 11:13 pm:

Just an addition to the thread about Legendary critters, since I noticed that it hadn't been mentioned in any of the threads.

Combining for WhiteHound, I made a thoroughbred line that included a Tiger/Ducken and two Tiger/Hares directly in the tree (i.e. grandparents). The Whitehound was still unlocked when I tested the newly combined Thoroughbred tiger with the S-level Gali that I had just finished raising.

So, yes. If you don't have a Tiger/Tiger, or just don't feel like using one, at least your grandparent tree and potentially parent and 'child' tree can be a Tiger/whatever. Potentially this is the same for the other thoroughbreds.

By Thorr on Thursday, October 28, 2010 - 04:49 am:

It's not the same for all thoroughbreds. Some are much more picky than others. Tiger was already known to be more forgiving.
